Class Reservation

extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Author:
    Group 2 [ ]
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double calculatePrice()
      Ah, my crown jewel, or at least I think so :S Anyhow, the point is to calculate the price that a customer needs to pay, we can do that if we know what type he is renting, and for how long Since we know the date of the pickup and the date of return we can calculate the number of days that the car is being reserved For date we use method called "daysInInterval()", that method returns the number of days Then we simply check what type of vehicle is rented and multiply the price per day for a specific vehicle with number of days
      boolean customerEquals(Customer customer)
      True of False method that checks if the inputed customer object is equal to the customer in the reservation
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
      Ordinary equals method for reservation
      void freeIntervalSpace()
      When the deed is done, and the vehicle is returned back to the company, we need to clear out the date in the vehicles date interval list Then we call this method which sparks off the chain-calling of other methods in order to delete the date interval
      java.lang.String getCustomerName() 
      java.lang.String getCustomerNumber() 
      void licenceInputer(java.lang.String licence)
      We input the drivers licence in the method which calls another method in customer which sets the driver licence field to the given string
      java.lang.String toString()
      Ordinary toString method

      • licenceInputer

        public void licenceInputer(java.lang.String licence)
        We input the drivers licence in the method which calls another method in customer which sets the driver licence field to the given string
        Parameters:
        licence - Licence that is inputed, basically a setter method

      • customerEquals

        public boolean customerEquals(Customer customer)
        True of False method that checks if the inputed customer object is equal to the customer in the reservation
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        True or false

      • getCustomerNumber

        public java.lang.String getCustomerNumber()

      • freeIntervalSpace

        public void freeIntervalSpace()
        When the deed is done, and the vehicle is returned back to the company, we need to clear out the date in the vehicles date interval list Then we call this method which sparks off the chain-calling of other methods in order to delete the date interval

      • calculatePrice

        public double calculatePrice()
        Ah, my crown jewel, or at least I think so :S Anyhow, the point is to calculate the price that a customer needs to pay, we can do that if we know what type he is renting, and for how long Since we know the date of the pickup and the date of return we can calculate the number of days that the car is being reserved For date we use method called "daysInInterval()", that method returns the number of days Then we simply check what type of vehicle is rented and multiply the price per day for a specific vehicle with number of days

        Ordinary equals method for reservation
